Craig Severance]], [[Yasuo Matsui]], et al. | architecture =Skyscraper | added = June 16, 2000 | area = less than one acre | governing_body = Private | refnum = 00000577<ref name="nris">{{NRISref|2009a}}</ref> }} }}
'''40 Wall Street''', also known as the '''Trump Building''', is a 71-story neo-gothic [[skyscraper]] between [[Nassau Street (Manhattan)|Nassau Street]] and [[William Street (Manhattan)|William Street]] in [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]]. Erected by [[The Manhattan Company]] as its headquarters, the building was originally known as the '''Bank of Manhattan Trust Building''',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wirednewyork.com/skyscrapers/40wall/|title=40 Wall Street – The Trump Building|publisher=}}</ref> and also as the '''Manhattan Company Building''',<ref name=nris/> until its founding tenant merged to form the [[Chase Manhattan Bank]].<ref name="AIA">{{cite AIA4}}. p.019.</ref> The structure was completed in 1930 after 11 months of construction.
== Architecture == [[Image:40 Wall Street Manhattan New York City.jpg|thumb|left|200px|An early picture of the Manhattan Company Building.]]
The building was designed by [[H. Craig Severance]], along with [[Yasuo Matsui]] (associate architect), and [[Shreve, Lamb & Harmon|Shreve & Lamb]] (consulting architects). [[Purdy and Henderson, Engineers|Purdy and Henderson]] were the structural engineers. [[Edward F. Caldwell & Co.]] designed the lighting. [[Der Scutt]] of Der Scutt Architect designed the lobby and entrance renovation.<ref name="AIA"/> Its pinnacle reaches 927 feet (283 m) and was very briefly the [[World's tallest structures|tallest building in the world]], surpassed by a spire attached to the [[Chrysler Building]] a few months later.<ref name=CTBUH>{{cite web |url=http://ctbuh.org/AboutCTBUH/History/MeasuringTall/tabid/1320/language/en-US/Default.aspx |title=The History of Measuring Tall Buildings |work=Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat |accessdate=3 May 2012}}</ref>
== History ==
=== Competition for "world's tallest building" title === 40 Wall Street was originally proposed by the banker [[George L. Ohrstrom]] to be a 47-story tower. Shortly after, Ohrstrom modified his project to have 60 floors, but it was still below the {{convert|792|ft|m|adj=on}} [[Woolworth Building]] and the {{convert|808|ft|m|adj=on}} [[Chrysler Building]] project, announced in 1928.<ref name="Gray 1992"/> In April 1928, Severance increased 40 Wall's height to {{convert|840|ft|m}} with 62 floors, which would exceed the Woolworth's height by {{convert|48|ft|m}} and the Chrysler's by {{convert|32|ft|m}}.<ref name="Gray 1992"/> The two structures started competing for the distinction of "[[List of tallest buildings in the world|world's tallest building]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emporis.com/building/the-trump-building-new-york-city-ny-usa|title=Emporis Data "...a celebrated three-way race to become the tallest building in the world."|author=Emporis GmbH|publisher=Emporis.com|accessdate=September 27, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skyscraper.org/TALLEST_TOWERS/t_manco.htm|title=The Manhattan Company – Skyscraper.org; "...'race' to erect the tallest tower in the world."|publisher=Skyscraper.org|accessdate=September 27, 2010}}</ref> The [[Empire State Building]] on 34th Street and Fifth Avenue would enter the competition in 1929. The "Race into the Sky", as popular media called it at the time, was representative of the country's optimism in the 1920s, fueled by the building boom in major cities.<ref>{{cite book | last=Rasenberger | first=Jim | title=High Steel: The Daring Men Who Built the World's Greatest Skyline, 1881 to the Present | publisher=HarperCollins | year=2009 | isbn=978-0-06-174675-8 | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=XDSxwPx-yJ4C |pages=388–389}}</ref> The 40 Wall Street tower was revised from {{convert|840|ft|m}} to 925 feet in April 1929, making it the world's tallest.<ref name=Tauranac>{{cite book |title=The Empire State Building: The Making of a Landmark |last=Tauranac |first=John |publisher=Scribner |year=2014 |isbn=978-0-684-19678-7 |location=New York |pages= }}</ref>{{rp|130}} Severance increased the height of his project and then publicly claimed the title of the world's tallest building.<ref>Emporis Data – See source no.4 line 4; "Briefly held the world's tallest title until it was eclipsed by the spire of Chrysler Building."</ref> (This distinction excluded structures that were not fully habitable, such as the [[Eiffel Tower]].)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ctbuh.org/|title=Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat|publisher=}}</ref> Construction of 40 Wall Street began in May 1929 at a frantic pace, and it was completed twelve months later.<ref name="Gray 1992">{{cite news | last=Gray | first=Christopher | title=Streetscapes: 40 Wall Street; A Race for the Skies, Lost by a Spire | work=The New York Times| date=1992-11-15 | url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/11/15/realestate/streetscapes-40-wall-street-a-race-for-the-skies-lost-by-a-spire.html | access-date=2017-11-03}}</ref>
In response, the Chrysler's architect [[William Van Alen]] obtained permission for a {{Convert|38|m|ft|0|adj=on|sp=us}} long spire<ref name=Stravitz>{{cite book |last=Stravitz |first=David |title=The Chrysler Building: Creating a New York Icon Day by Day |year=2002 |publisher=Princeton Architectural Press |location=New York |isbn=1-56898-354-9}}</ref>{{rp|161}}<ref name=Binders/> and had it secretly constructed inside the frame of the building.<ref name=Tauranac/>{{rp|130}} The spire was delivered to the site in four different sections.<ref name=Stravitz/>{{rp|161}} On October 23, 1929, the day before the catastrophic [[Wall Street Crash of 1929]] started, the bottom section of the spire was slowly hoisted to the top of the building's dome and lowered into the 66th floor of the building.<ref name="Gray 1992"/> The other remaining sections of the spire were hoisted and riveted to the first one in sequential order in 90 minutes,<ref name=Stravitz/>{{rp|xiii, 161}} helping raise the tower's height to {{convert|1,046|ft|m}}.<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=w8djsCB8-OUC&pg=PA426|title=Chrysler: The Life and Times of an Automotive Genius|last=Curcio|first=V.|publisher=Oxford University Press|year=2001|isbn=978-0-19-514705-6|series=Automotive History and Personalities|location=|page=426}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=E30rCBeM8nkC|title=The History of Stainless Steel|last=Cobb|first=H.M.|publisher=ASM International|year=2010|isbn=978-1-61503-011-8|series=Asm Handbook|location=|page=110}}</ref> The steel tip brought the Chrysler Building to a height of {{convert|1046|ft|m}}, greatly exceeding 40 Wall Street's height.<ref>{{cite book |title=Building the Empire State |last=Willis |first=Carol |last2=Friedman |first2=Donald |publisher=W.W. Norton |year=1998 |isbn=978-0-393-73030-2 |location=New York |page=14}}</ref> Once completed on May 28, 1930, the Chrysler Building surpassed 40 Wall Street as the tallest building in the world, fulfilling Chrysler's dream.<ref name=Tauranac/>{{rp|130}}
Upset by Chrysler's victory, [[William F. Lamb|Shreve & Lamb]], consulting architects of 40 Wall Street, wrote a newspaper article claiming that their building was the tallest, since it contained the world's highest usable floor. They pointed out that the observation deck in the Bank of Manhattan Building was nearly {{convert|100|ft|m}} above the top floor in the Chrysler Building, whose surpassing spire was strictly ornamental and essentially inaccessible.<ref name=Binders>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Lcir7wwIzhIC&pg=PA102|title=101 of the World's Tallest Buildings|last=Binders|first=George|publisher=Images Pub.|year=2006|isbn=978-1-86470-173-9|location=|page=102}}</ref> This became a moot point when the Empire State Building was completed eleven months later in May 1931, becoming the world's tallest building in both of those categories, at {{convert|1250|ft|m}}.<ref name=CTBUH/><ref name=Tauranac/>{{rp|185}}
The Bank of Manhattan Building had an observation deck on the 69th and 70th floors, located {{Convert|836|ft|m}} above the street, with the observatory able to fit up to 100 people.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1930/06/01/118375009.pdf|title=TOWER RISES 836 FEET.; Lofty Observation Floor in Bank of Manhattan Building.|last=|first=|date=1930-06-01|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-11-07|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> A bronze statue of [[Oceanus]], a Greek god, was also erected atop the building.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1930/04/26/96109916.pdf|title=OCEANUS ADORNS FACADE.; New Skyscraper for Bank of Manhattan Building Gets Statue.|last=|first=|date=1930-04-26|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-11-07|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
=== Foreclosure === In 1939, the Marine Midland Trust Company started [[foreclosure]] proceedings against the Forty Wall Street Corporation after the corporation [[Default (finance)|defaulted]] on "payments of interest, taxes and other charges".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1939/05/25/93918517.pdf|title=START FORECLOSURE ON 40 WALL STREET; Trustee Presents Reorganization Plan for Skyscraper|last=|first=|date=1939-05-25|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-11-07|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> Bondholders acquired the building in 1940 in a transaction worth almost $11.5 million.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1940/09/26/94001232.pdf|title=Bondholders Acquire 40 Wall Street Building On Bid of $11,489,500 in Reorganization Plan|last=|first=|date=1940-09-26|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-11-07|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
=== 1946 plane crash === On the evening of May 20, 1946, a [[United States Army Air Forces]] [[Beechcraft Model 18|Beechcraft C-45F Expediter]] airplane crashed into the north side of the building. The twin-engined plane was heading for [[Newark Liberty International Airport|Newark Airport]] on a flight originating at [[Chennault Air Force Base|Lake Charles Army Air Field]] in [[Louisiana]]. It struck the 58th floor of the building at about 8:10 PM, creating a {{convert|20|x|10|ft|m|adj=on}} hole in the masonry, and killing all five aboard the plane, including a [[Women's Army Corps (United States Army)|WAC]] officer. The fuselage and the wing of the splintered plane fell and caught onto the 12th story ledge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://archives.chicagotribune.com/1946/05/21/page/1/article/plane-hits-wall-st-bank|title=PLANE HITS WALL ST. BANK (May 21, 1946)|publisher=}}</ref>
Fog and low visibility were identified as the main causes of the crash. At the time of the accident, [[LaGuardia Airport|LaGuardia Field]] reported a heavy fog that reduced the ceiling to {{convert|500|ft|m}}, obscuring the view of the ground for the pilot at the building's 58th story level. Parts of the aircraft and pieces of brick and mortar from the building fell into the street below, but there were no reported injuries to any of the estimated 2,000 workers in the building, nor anyone on the street.<ref name="NYT">"Pilot Lost in Fog," ''New York Times,'' May 21, 1946, p. 1</ref>
This crash at 40 Wall Street was the second of its kind in New York City's history, the first being when an Army [[B-25 Mitchell|B-25]] bomber [[B-25 Empire State Building crash|struck the 78th floor]] of the [[Empire State Building]] in July 1945. The cause of that crash was also fog and poor visibility.<ref name="NYT"/> The 1946 accident was the last time an airplane accidentally struck a skyscraper in New York City until October 11, 2006, when a small plane carrying [[New York Yankees]] pitcher [[Cory Lidle]] [[2006 New York City plane crash|crashed into a 50-story condo building]] on Manhattan's Upper East Side.<ref>Levy, Matthys and Salvadori, Mario, ''Why Buildings Fall Down: How Structures Fail'' (2002), p. 30: "… no plane has accidentally hit a skyscraper since the Empire State and Wall Street catastrophes." [https://books.google.com/books?id=Bwd-MHINMGsC&lpg=PA30&pg=PA30#v=onepage&q=&f=false]</ref><ref name="mlb_death">[http://mlb.mlb.com/NASApp/mlb/news/article.jsp?ymd=20061011&content_id=1708962&vkey=news_mlb&fext=.jsp&c_id=mlb Yankees' Lidle killed in plane crash], Mark Feinsand, ''MLB.com,'' October 11, 2006</ref>
=== Decline and revival === [[Image:Lower part of The Trump Building in New York City IMG 1693.JPG|thumb|250px|40 Wall Street at ground level.|left]] In 1982, Joseph J. and Ralph E. Bernstein purchased leasing rights of 40 Wall Street and were later found to be acting on behalf of [[Ferdinand E. Marcos]], the President of the [[Philippines]]. When Marcos was removed from power and his assets in the United States were frozen, the building was placed in limbo.<ref>Oser, Alan S. [https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9F0CEFD9173CF933A15755C0A965958260 "Perspectives: 40 Wall Street; Asian Buyer Accepts a Leasing Challenge"], ''New York Times'', 20 June 1993.</ref> [[Citigroup|Citicorp]] then decided to undertake a $50 million renovation of 40 Wall Street, but the renovation was canceled in 1991 due to concerns that the tenants might move out.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1991/11/10/realestate/commercial-property-40-wall-street-citicorp-aborts-50-million-financing.html|title=Commercial Property: 40 Wall Street; Citicorp Aborts $50 Million Financing of Renovation|last=Dunlap|first=David W.|date=1991-11-10|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-11-07|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
In December 1995, after years of neglect, the lease was transferred to [[Donald Trump]], who later renamed the building the "Trump Building".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1995/12/07/business/40-wall-street-is-sold-to-trump.html|title=40 Wall Street Is Sold to Trump|last=News|first=Bloomberg Business|date=1995-12-07|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-11-07|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://therealdeal.com/2017/01/06/meet-the-obscure-german-magnates-who-actually-own-trumps-most-valuable-building/ |title=Meet the obscure German magnates who actually own Trump's most valuable building|date=6 January 2017|work=The Real Deal}}</ref> He planned to convert the upper half of it to residential space, leaving the bottom half as commercial space. The cost of converting it to residential space proved to be too high, and it remains 100% commercial space.<ref>{{cite book |first=George H. |last=Ross |title=Trump Strategies for Real Estate: Billionaire Lessons for the Small Investor |location= |publisher=John Wiley & Sons |year=2005 |page=51 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=IQ3l-QD6nmIC&pg=PA51 }}</ref> He tried to sell the building in 2003, expecting offers in excess of $300 million. They did not materialize. In the ninth episode of the fourth season of ''[[The Apprentice (U.S. season 4)|The Apprentice]]'', Trump claimed he only paid $1 million for the building, but that it was actually worth $400 million. This episode aired November 17, 2005. Trump's legal advisor, [[George H. Ross]], restated this claim in a 2005 book.<ref>{{cite book |first=George H. |last=Ross |title=Trump Strategies for Real Estate: Billionaire Lessons for the Small Investor |location= |publisher=John Wiley & Sons |year=2005 |page=50 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=IQ3l-QD6nmIC&pg=PA50 }}</ref>
On CNBC's ''The Billionaire Inside'', Trump again claimed he paid $1 million for the building, but stated the value as $600 million, a $200 million increase from two years earlier. The episode aired October 17, 2007, on CNBC. However, it has also been reported that Trump paid $10 million for the building and the building is now worth $1 billion.<ref>[http://therealdeal.com/blog/2012/01/23/trump-fills-40-wall-street-with-high-incentives-low-rents/ "Trump fills 40 Wall Street with low rents, incentives"], ''The Real Deal'', 23 January 2012.</ref> According to 2015 Federal Election Commission filings, Trump has an outstanding mortgage on the property in excess of $50 million.<ref name=Zurcher23July>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-33644498|title=Five take-aways from Donald Trump's financial disclosure|work=BBC|date=July 23, 2015|accessdate=March 2, 2016|first=Anthony|last=Zurcher}}</ref>
In 1998, the building was designated a landmark by the [[List of New York City Designated Landmarks in Manhattan|New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission]]. The tower was the tallest mid-block building in New York City until the completion of [[One57]] in 2014.<ref>http://www.snopes.com/trump-bragged-tallest-building/</ref>

{{Infobox building | name = 44 Montgomery | image = 44 Montgomery Street San Francisco.jpg | image_size = 250px | caption = 44 Montgomery Street (left), overshadowing the neighboring [[Hobart Building]]. | location = 44 [[Montgomery Street]]
[[San Francisco]], [[California]] | coordinates = {{coord|37.7898|-122.4018|region:US-CA|display=inline,title}} | pushpin_map = United States San Francisco Central#California#USA | highest_region = San Francisco | highest_prev = [[650 California Street|Hartford Building]] | highest_next = [[555 California Street|Bank of America Center]] | start_date = 1966 | completion_date = 1967 | status = completed | building_type = Commercial offices | antenna_spire = {{convert|180.7|m|abbr=on}} | roof = {{convert|172.2|m|abbr=on}} | top_floor = | floor_count = 43 | elevator_count = 18 | cost = | floor_area = {{convert|760,524|sqft|abbr=on}} | architect = [[John Graham & Company]] | structural_engineer= | main_contractor = [[Dillingham Construction]]
[[Haas & Haynie]] | developer = | owner = | management = Seagate Properties | references = {{ctbuh|2624}}{{emporis|118786}}{{skyscraperpage|2133}}{{structurae|s0021540}} }} '''44 Montgomery''' is a 43-story, {{convert|172|m|abbr=on}} [[office]] [[skyscraper]] in the heart of [[San Francisco, California|San Francisco's]] [[Financial District (San Francisco)|Financial District]]. When completed in 1967, it was the tallest building west of [[Dallas]], it was surpassed by [[555 California Street]] (the former world headquarters of [[Bank of America]]) in 1969. The building was designed, built and dedicated for [[Wells Fargo|Wells Fargo Bank]], and their IT subsidiary was based there at one time (the bank's headquarters are at 464 California Street)Some sources list 44 Montgomery as the Wells Fargo world headquarters, but Wells Fargo annual reports going back to 1967 list either 464 California Street or 420 Montgomery Street as the official headquarters for Wells Fargo Bank and Wells, Fargo and Company (after 1969).. The building was sold by [[AT&T]] in 1997 for US$111 million. 44 Montgomery, as part of the original design anticipating the then-under-construction [[Bay Area Rapid Transit]] subway system, contains direct underground access to the [[Montgomery Street station|Montgomery Street Station]]. == Tenants == Tenants include: * [[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission]] * [[Locke Lord]] * [[Alpha Omega Financial Systems]] * [[AppleOne Employment Services]] * [[Armanino LLP]] * [[Invest Northern Ireland]] * [[Northwestern University]] * [[Signature Consultants]] * [[Seagate Properties, Inc.]] * [[Landrum & Brown]] * [[RSM US LLP]] ==See also== {{Portal|San Francisco Bay Area}} *[[List of tallest buildings in San Francisco]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.44montgomery.com/ 44 Montgomery Street official website] {{Buildings in California timeline}} {{Buildings in San Francisco timeline}} {{Buildings in San Francisco}} [[Category:Financial District, San Francisco]] [[Category:Office buildings completed in 1967]] [[Category:Skyscraper office buildings in San Francisco]]

{{Infobox officeholder | name = Abdus Salam Murshedy | native_name = আব্দুস সালাম মুর্শেদী | native_name_lang = bn | image = Abdus Salam Murshedy 2018 (1) (cropped).jpg | caption = Murshedy in 2018 | birth_place = [[Khulna District]], Bangladesh | nationality = Bangladeshi | known_for = Football player, businessman, politician | office = Member of the [[Jatiya Sangsad]] from [[Khulna-4]] | predecessor = [[Mostafa Rashidi Suja]] | term_start = 4 September 2018 | occupation = Business | awards = [[National Sports Awards]], 2003 }}
'''Abdus Salam Murshedy''' is a [[Bangladesh]]i politician, entrepreneur and former national team football player. Aligned with the [[Bangladesh Awami League]], he is elected uncontested as member of the [[Jatiya Sangsad]] for [[Khulna-4]] since September 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://en.prothomalo.com/bangladesh/news/182819/Salam-Murshedy-elected-MP-uncontested|title=Salam Murshedy elected MP uncontested|work=Prothom Alo|access-date=2018-09-05|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://bdnews24.com/politics/2018/09/04/salam-murshedy-elected-khulna-4-mp-in-uncontested-by-polls|title=Salam Murshedy elected Khulna-4 MP in uncontested by-polls|access-date=2018-09-05}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.banglanews24.com/english/national/article/70695/salam-murshedy-elected-mp-of-khulna-3-uncontested|title=Salam Murshedy elected MP of Khulna-3 uncontested|last=http://www.banglanews24.com|website=www.banglanews24.com|language=en|access-date=2018-09-06}}</ref> He is the Managing Director of Envoy Group, Senior Vice President of [[Bangladesh Football Federation|Bangladesh Football Federation (BFF)]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thedailystar.net/news-detail-232327|title=Young blood at BFF|date=2012-05-01|work=The Daily Star|access-date=2018-08-27|language=en}}</ref> President of Exporters Association of Bangladesh (EAB)<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.dhakatribune.com/business/2018/06/01/bangladesh-needs-long-term-policies-to-attract-investment|title='Bangladesh needs long term policies to attract investment'|date=2018-05-31|work=Dhaka Tribune|access-date=2018-08-27|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://en.prothomalo.com/economy/news/77365/Utility-price-hike-to-hurt-export-sector|title='Utility price-hike to hurt export sector'|work=Prothom Alo|access-date=2018-08-27|language=en}}</ref> and former President of [[Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association|Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters' Association (BGMEA)]]. He is the candidate nominated by the [[Awami League]] nominated by the [[Khulna-4]] constituency by-election.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://en.banglatribune.com/national/news/11399/H.S.C-passed-Salam-Murshedi%E2%80%99s-annual-income-around|title=HSC passed Salam Murshedi’s annual income around Tk 60m|work=Bangla Tribune|access-date=2018-08-27|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.daily-sun.com/post/331060/AL-nominates-Abdus-Salam-Murshedy-for-next-general-election|title=Awami League nominates Abdus Salam Murshedy for Khulna-4 by-polls {{!}} daily sun|last=Sun|first=The Daily|work=Daily Sun|access-date=2018-08-27|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.risingbd.com/english/Khulna-4-by-polls-Salam-Murshedy-submits-nomination-paper/56102|title=Khulna-4 by-polls: Salam Murshedy submits nomination paper|last=risingbd.com|work=risingbd.com|access-date=2018-08-27|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newagebd.net/article/48907/al-nominates-abdus-salam-murshedy-for-khulna-4-by-election|title=AL nominates Abdus Salam Murshedy for Khulna-4 by-election|website=New Age {{!}} The Outspoken Daily|language=en|access-date=2018-08-27}}</ref> He has been elected as a [[Commercially Important Person| Commercially Important Person (CIP)]] by the [[Government of Bangladesh]] in 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mincom.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/mincom.portal.gov.bd/page/91526f19_409d_421f_ac49_af417f4d5b14/CIP-2014%20Gadget.pdf|title=Commercially Important Person 2014|last=|first=|date=October 24, 2017|website=Ministry of Commerce, Government of Bangladesh|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=August 27, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://samakal.com/todays-print-edition/tp-industry-trade/article/1808828/%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%86%E0%A6%87%E0%A6%AA%E0%A6%BF-%E0%A6%B9%E0%A6%B2%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%A8-%E0%A7%A7%E0%A7%AD%E0%A7%AE-%E0%A6%AC%E0%A7%8D%E0%A6%AF%E0%A6%AC%E0%A6%B8%E0%A6%BE%E0%A7%9F%E0%A7%80|title=সিআইপি হলেন ১৭৮ ব্যবসায়ী|last=|first=|date=August 5, 2018|work=The Daily Samakal|access-date=August 27, 2018|language=bn}}</ref>
==Early life and education== Murshedy was born in [[Rupsa Upazila]], [[Khulna district]]. His father Mohammad Israel and mother Rizia Khatun.
==Career== Murshedy is the managing director of Envoy Group.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.envoy-group.com/md-profile.php|title=Envoy Group|website=www.envoy-group.com|language=en|access-date=2018-08-27}}</ref> Besides, he is the director of [[Premier Bank Limited|Premier Bank]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://premierbankltd.com/pbl/directors-profile-2/|title=Director’s Profile - Home|website=premierbankltd.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-27}}</ref> He started Envoy Garment's journey in 1984. Later he made 15 more ready made garments companies. He is currently the president of Bangladesh Exporters Association (EAB), Senior Vice President of [[Bangladesh Football Federation|Bangladesh Football Federation (BFF)]], member of the Board of Directors of [[BGMEA Institute of Fashion & Technology|Bangladesh University of Fashion and Technology (BUFT)]]. Earlier, he was appointed as the president of [[Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association]] (BGMEA) and director of Bangladesh [[Mohammedan Sporting Club (Dhaka)|Mohammedan Sporting Club]].
== Sports == Murshedy started playing football in Khulna. In the '70s, he started his journey to football by playing for Young Boys Club of Khulna. He came to [[Dhaka]] from [[Khulna]] in the late seventies. At that time, he started playing in Dhaka Senior Division Football League for Azad Sporting Club. He scored a maximum of 27 goals in a season of national football league. The record for the highest goal of 1982 is still there.

== Personal life == Murshedy is married to Sharmin Salam. They have two son, one daughter.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.kalerkantho.com/print-edition/khalar-ghor/2015/05/15/221975|title=আমার অর্থ অর্জন সম্মান সব কিছুর মূলে ফুটবল |work=Kalerkantho|access-date=2018-08-28|language=bn}}</ref>

{{news release|1=article|date=July 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Anthony Masunga | image = Anthony Masunga.jpg | caption = Anthony Masunga, officially opening the [[Masunga]] skills room donated by [[Botswana Telecommunications Corporation|BTC]], at the [[World Information Society Day|world telecommunications and information society day]] 2017 | birth_name = Anthony Masunga | birth_date = 1973 | birth_place = [[Francistown]], [[Botswana]] | occupation = [[Bank of Botswana]],[[Botswana National productivity center]],[[chief operating officer]] at [[Botswana Telecommunications Corporation|Be-mobile]] | networth = | spouse = [[Bertha Masunga]] | children = 2 | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Botswana]], [[De Montfort University]],[[De Montfort University]], | website = | signature = | parents = }} '''Anthony Masunga''' is the newly appointed [[chief operating officer]] for [[Botswana Telecommunications Corporation]], from the previous appointment of being a general manager and acting manager commercial.{{cite web|last1=Masunga|first1=Anthony|title=Appointment as Chief Operating Officer at Be-mobile|url=http://www.sundaystandard.info/new-era-begins-btc|website=www.sundaystandard.info/new-era-begins-btc|publisher=Sunday Standard|accessdate=2 June 2017|ref=Golekanye Molapisi}} The [[Francistown]]-born Anthony Masunga started working as a chief operating officer and chief executive officer in January 2017. == Background == Anthony Masunga has been appointed the managing director of the BTC company since the year 2017 inception and he served as the acting managing director of the same company since the year 2016 July 20 until he received the current appointment. Mr. Masunga served as Acting Managing Director of [[Botswana Telecommunications Corporation]] Limited since July 20, 2016 until January 1, 2017. He is the chief technical officer for the [[MASCOM|Mascom wireless]] company. == Education == Bachelor of Science McGill University.
Anthony Masunga did his part 1 Bachelor of science at the [[University of Botswana]] and furthered his studies to do Bachelors in computer science at the [[McGill University]] in [[Canada]], [[Montreal]] province.{{cite web|last1=Masunga|first1=Anthony|title=Chief operating officer|url=https://www.tsena.co.bw/mr-anthony-masunga|website=Tsena|publisher=Tsena Botswana|accessdate=13 June 2017}} Anthony Masunga also holds a Master's degree in Business Administration from the [[De Montfort University]]. ==Occupation== '''1995'''
Anthony Masunga had his first job after graduating at the national [[Bank of Botswana]] as a systems analyst in 1995. He only served one year contract and left for another company, his main role was to fix computer systems. He worked with too many controls.
'''1996'''
He got another job at the [[Botswana national productivity centre]] (Bnpc) in the year 1996 as a consultant for information technology and giving education to the government officials about the utilisation of the information communication technology tools in order to improve productivity. Anthony Masunga spent two operation years with the [[Botswana national productivity centre]]. Anthony together with his colleagues who were from the [[United Kingdom|United kingdom]] at the [[Botswana national productivity centre]] established their own consulting firm which was closed down. Anthony later joined [[MASCOM|Mascom wireless]] as a information technology manager. After three years Anthony was moved into another position of the [[Chief Technology Officer|chief technical officer]] at Mascom wireless company at the age of 32 as the first [[Chief Technology Officer|chief technical officer]] of [[MASCOM|Mascom wireless]].
'''2008'''
In the year 2008, Mr. Anthony Masunga joined the Be-mobile team, which after three months he took over to the Launch Director as the founding General Manager. == Role at BTC == Mr. Anthony Masunga’s current role is to administer the merger of the [[Botswana Telecommunications Corporation|BTC]] and BeMobile brands. His goal is to infuse a performance driven culture that will drive efficient service delivery across all clientele, grow their subscriber base as well as profitability. == Other Affiliations == [[McGill University]]
Chief technical officer at [[MASCOM|Mascom Wireless]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Masunga, Anthony}} [[Category:Botswana businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1973 births]] {{Botswana-bio-stub}}

{{Infobox company | name = Association of Old Crows | logo = Association of Old Crows (logo).png | type = [[Non-profit]] | foundation = 1964 | location = {{nowrap| [[Alexandria, Virginia]], [[United States]]}} | area_served = Worldwide | industry = [[Electronic Warfare]], [[Information Operations]], [[Cyberwarfare]] | homepage = {{URL|http://www.crows.org/}} }} The '''Association of Old Crows''' is an international professional organization specializing in [[electronic warfare]], tactical information operations, and associated disciplines headquartered in [[Alexandria, Virginia]]. This nonprofit organization's mission is to "advocate the need for a strong defense capability emphasizing electronic warfare and information operations to government, industry, academia, and the public."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.crows.org/about/mission-a-history.html|title=Mission & History – Uncategorized – About|author=Bridgette Anderson|publisher=|accessdate=8 December 2015}}</ref>
The name "Old Crows" emerged from the first use of electronic warfare in [[World War II]] to disrupt [[Axis powers|Axis]] communications and radars. [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] equipment and operators were known by the code name "Raven". Common jargon changed the name to "Crows" and those engaged in the profession became known as "Old Crows".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buffalostate.edu/physics/x757.xml |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-08-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928144251/http://www.buffalostate.edu/physics/x757.xml |archivedate=2011-09-28 |df= }}</ref>
The organization draws expertise and information from its members, a pool of thousands of individuals including technology specialists and actual military personnel, and is involved in advancing electronic warfare and [[Intelligence assessment|information-gathering]] techniques, disseminating information on these topics, and supporting the education of personnel in related scientific matters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.crows.org/about/about-aoc.html|title=About AOC – Uncategorized – About|author=Bridgette Anderson|publisher=|accessdate=8 December 2015}}</ref>
It publishes the ''[[Journal of Electronic Defense]],'' a journal covering international developments in the fields of electronic warfare, [[signals intelligence]], [[electronic intelligence]] and [[communications intelligence]].

'''Azeb Mesfin Haile'''<ref name="hopr">{{Cite web|title=Tigray |url=http://www.hopr.gov.et/c/document_library/get_file?p_l_id=11494&folderId=11516&name=DLFE-111.pdf |publisher=[[House of Peoples' Representatives]] |quote=6. Hon.W/ro Azeb Mesfin Haile |accessdate=2013-10-09 }}{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> is the widow of [[List of heads of government of Ethiopia|Ethiopian Prime Minister]] [[Meles Zenawi]].<ref>{{cite news|author=David Smith |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/aug/21/meles-zenawi-death-fears-turmoil?newsfeed=true|title=Ethiopian PM Meles Zenawi's death sparks fears of turmoil|publisher=The Guardian|date=30 March 2012|accessdate=22 August 2012}}</ref> She is the founder and patron of Ethiopia's National Initiative for Mental Health.<ref>[http://www.ghanatoday.com/index.php?option=news&task=viewarticle&sid=22190 Azeb Mesfin Vice President of OAFLA] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110101033613/http://www.ghanatoday.com/index.php?option=news&task=viewarticle&sid=22190 |date=January 1, 2011 }}</ref> In early 2009, she was appointed CEO of the Endowment Fund for the Rehabilitation of Tigray by its head Abadi Zemu.<ref>[http://www.addisfortune.com/First%20Lady%20Makes%20it%20to%20EFFORT's%20Helm.htm "First Lady Makes it to EFFORT's Helm"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090402191532/http://www.addisfortune.com/First%20Lady%20Makes%20it%20to%20EFFORT%27s%20Helm.htm |date=2009-04-02 }}, ''Addis Fortune'', published March 2009 (accessed 5 May 2010)</ref>
== Political career == Azeb, born in [[Wolqayt]],<ref name="fortune2013-09-08">{{Cite news| title=Azeb Mesfin, MP and Widow of Meles Zenawi | url=http://addisfortune.net/articles/azeb-mesfin-mp-and-widow-of-meles-zenawi/ | newspaper=[[Addis Fortune]] | location=Addis Ababa | date=2013-09-08 | accessdate=2013-10-09 }}</ref> was married to Ethiopian Prime Minister [[Meles Zenawi]] until his death in 2012. Together they had three children: Semhal, Marda and Senay Meles. She was elected in 2005 to the [[House of Peoples' Representatives]] (the lower House of the [[Federal Parliamentary Assembly|Ethiopian Parliament]]) representing her home [[woreda]] of [[Wolqayt]] and [[Humera]], and serves as chair of its Social Affairs Standing Committee. Her role has at times been controversial, with some members of Ethiopia's [[diaspora]] alleging that, during the period in which she was an executive at the parastatal Mega Corporation, she was involved in "the impropriety of mingling public, private and party-owned businesses."<ref>Gelaw, Abebe, "[http://www.ethiomedia.com/courier/queen_of_mega.html The 'Queen of Mega' in Parliament] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070117022459/http://www.ethiomedia.com/courier/queen_of_mega.html |date=2007-01-17 }}," Ethiomedia, 24 January 2006. (accessed 30 September 2006)</ref>
However Azeb is also known for her work to teach rural Ethiopians about the issues of [[HIV/AIDS in Ethiopia|HIV/AIDS]] Her appearance at a special ceremony to honor the First Ladies of Africa for their efforts against the spread of HIV/AIDS held by [[Georgetown University]] of Washington DC on 15 January 2007 was met by protests of exiled Ethiopians."<ref>Mays, Kate, "[http://www.ethiomedia.com/addfile/group_disrupts_mlk_commemoration.html Group Objects to University Giving Award to 'First Lady', Protests Disrupt MLK Jr Commemoration]," Ethiomedia, 18 January 2007. Retrieved January 18, 2007.</ref> The University was awarding its "John Thompson Legacy of a Dream Award" to the [[Organisation of African First Ladies against HIV/AIDS]] for its leadership and service toward the ideals of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Mesfin was to accept the award on behalf of the organization along with the first ladies of Zambia and Rwanda. She started the organization "Ethiopian Coalition of Women against HIV/AIDS" and continues to work closely with community leaders to ensure the rights of women,fight harmful traditional practices and HIV/AIDS.<ref>[http://allafrica.com/stories/200701221034.html Ethiopian Coalition of Women against HIV]</ref> She said the award she received is not just for her organization but for the entire Ethiopian women declaring "the award is the result of the relentless struggle waged by Ethiopian women."<ref>{{Cite web | url=http://www.waltainfo.com/EnNews/2007/Jan/23Jan07/23555.htm |title= 'Legacy of a Dream Award' belongs to entire Ethiopian women: Azeb | publisher=Walta Information Center | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070331050853/http://www.waltainfo.com/EnNews/2007/Jan/23Jan07/23555.htm | archivedate=2007-03-31 }}</ref>

[[Edgar Bronfman, Sr.|Edgar Miles Bronfman]] (grandfather)
[[Hannah Bronfman]] (sister)}} '''Benjamin Zachary Bronfman''' (born August 6, 1982) is an American entrepreneur and musician. Bronfman is a strategic advisor and principal investor with Algae Systems, a carbon capture project and an associate managing director at Global Thermostat, a bio-fuel company. He was a member of rock band [[The Exit]] (going by the name '''Ben Brewer''') and he is a member of the music collective Teachers and co-founder of the Green Owl record label. He is the second-eldest child of actress Sherry Brewer and [[Edgar Bronfman Jr.]] the former CEO of [[Warner Music Group]]. He and musician and activist [[M.I.A. (artist)|Mathangi "Maya" Arulpragasam]], better known under the stage name M.I.A., were engaged from 2009-2012 and have a son together. ==Early life and education== Bronfman was born in New York City, and then lived in London briefly, during his father's tenure as managing director of [[Seagram|Seagram Distilleries]] Europe. The family returned in 1984, once his father became President of Seagram's U.S. marketing division. His mother is [[African-American]] and his father is [[Jewish American]].{{cite web|last1=Ogunnaike|first1=Lola|title=EBONY: Meet The Black Bronfmans|url=http://sandrarose.com/2011/07/ebony-meet-the-black-bronfmans/|website=SandraRose.com|accessdate=September 24, 2015|date=July 15, 2011}}[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-21237697.html "Seagram chairman admits he never approved of son's marriage to a Black woman"], ''Jet'', March. 23, 1998. He is a member of the [[Lehman family]] via his paternal grandmother, Ann Loeb Bronfman.{{cite web|title=Ann L. Bronfman: Obituary|url=http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/nytimes/obituary.aspx?pid=150140174|work=Legacy.com|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=December 24, 2013|date=April 10, 2011}} Bronfman attended [[The Collegiate School]] in New York City, graduating in 2000. He enrolled in [[Emerson College]] in [[Boston]], Massachusetts, where he studied Politics and Law before dropping out. ==Environment and technology== Bronfman became interested in progressive environmental technologies & geo-engineering in 2007. Teaming with [[Columbia University]] economist Graciela Chichilinsky he embarked on a project to reduce the atmospheric concentration of [[carbon dioxide]]. In 2007, he became associate managing director of Global Thermostat, Chichilinsky and fellow Columbia Professor, Peter Eisenberger's technology firm focused on developing a technology for direct air-capture of carbon dioxide.Pompeo, Joe. "[http://observer.com/2009/11/the-bedstuy-bronfman/ The Bed-Stuy Bronfman]", ''[[The New York Observer]]'', November 24, 2009. Retrieved September 24, 2015. The firm recently{{when|date=March 2011}} completed construction of its first pilot plant at The [[Stanford Research Institute]].Gunther, Marc. "[http://www.greenbiz.com/blog/2010/12/23/can-global-thermostat-turn-climate-change-around Can a 'Global Thermostat' Turn Climate Change Around?]", ''GreenBiz.com'', December 23, 2010. Retrieved September 24, 2015. He was integral in convincing his father to invest in the firm, and thus the subsequent appointment of Edgar Bronfman Jr. as chairman. In 2010, Benjamin Bronfman was named Strategic Advisor of Global Thermostat. On November 13, 2010, Bronfman presented Global Thermostat's vision and process as a speaker at the [[Ted (conference)|TED]] Brooklyn Conference at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, NY.Jovanovic, Rozalia. [http://www.blackbookmag.com/article/tedxbrooklyn-elitism-worth-spreading/23504 TEDx Brooklyn: Elitism worth spreading]", ''BlackBookMag.com'', November 25, 2010. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110130212843/http://www.blackbookmag.com/article/tedxbrooklyn-elitism-worth-spreading/23504|date=January 30, 2011}} In 2010, Bronfman also became a principal investor and advisor at Algae Systems, LLC,{{cite web|last1=Kanellos|first1=Michael|title=Sewage-to-Algae Unites Whiskey Fortune, Dead Lyricist, GreenFuel, and NASA|url=http://www.greentechmedia.com/articles/read/sewage-to-algae-unites-whiskey-fortune-dead-lyricist-greenfuel-and-nasa|website=GreenTechMedia.com|accessdate=September 24, 2015|date=June 22, 2010}} a third-generation bio-fuel company founded by Matthew Atwood that takes waste water from cities (using CO2 captured by GT) and generates jet fuel and diesel. ==Music== [[File:TheExit.jpg|thumb|Bronfman performing with The Exit in 2004]] Bronfman was guitarist for [[The Exit]], an indie/punk/reggae rock band he started with Gunnar Olsen and [[Jeff DaRosa]] in 2000, while he attended [[Emerson College]]. During this time period, he went by Ben Brewer, using his mother's maiden name to avoid unnecessary associations between the band and his father. In 2007, shortly after the official announcement of The Exit's breakup, Bronfman founded Green Owl, an independent record label distributed by Warner Music Group, created to be the first environmentally conscious sustainable record label and apparel line.{{cite web|title=Green Beat: The First Eco-friendly Record Label|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/online/daily/2008/04/green-beat-the.html|website=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|accessdate=September 24, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091130181612/http://www.vanityfair.com/online/daily/2008/04/green-beat-the.html|archivedate=November 30, 2009 |date=April 8, 2008}}{{failed verification|date=September 2015}} In 2010, he started a music collective known as [[Teachers]] (sometimes stylized T∑∆CH∑RS) with Grey McMurray, Steve Borth, Matt Kranz, and Scottie Redix. The first single, "Gold", debuted on the website of the music editorial, [[The Fader]], on July 12, 2010.Macia, Peter. "[http://www.thefader.com/2010/07/12/teachers-gold-mp3-teaser-video/ Teachers, 'Gold' MP3 + Teaser Video]", ''The Fader'', July 12, 2010. Retrieved September 24, 2015. Bronfman and Teachers worked with [[Kanye West]] and contributed to his single "[[Monster (Kanye West song)|Monster]]" featuring [[Jay-Z]], [[Nicki Minaj]], [[Rick Ross (rapper)|Rick Ross]] and [[Bon Iver]]. In 2013, Teachers co-produced New Slaves, the first single out of Kanye's [[Yeezus]] album, earning Bronfman his first Grammy nomination.{{cite web|title=Exclusive: Hear Kanye West's Original Instrumental 'New Slaves' Demo|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/premieres/exclusive-hear-kanye-wests-original-instrumental-new-slaves-demo-20141027|website=[[Rolling Stone]]|accessdate=15 January 2018}} ==Personal life== Bronfman met British recording artist, songwriter, painter and director [[M.I.A. (rapper)|M.I.A.]] in the [[Bedford-Stuyvesant]] neighborhood of [[Brooklyn, New York]]. They became engaged and M.I.A gave birth to their son, Ikhyd Edgar Arular Bronfman, on February 13, 2009. In February 2012, it was announced that the two had separated.[http://blog.sfgate.com/dailydish/2013/03/13/m-i-a-goes-public-with-child-custody-battle/ SF Gate: "M.I.A. goes public with child custody battle"] March 13, 2013 Bronfman has two sisters, [[Hannah Bronfman|Hannah]] and Vanessa. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://algaesystems.com/company/advisors/ Algae Systems official website] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20150925111733/http://globalthermostat.com/what-we-do/about-carbon-capture-and-use/ Global Thermostat official website] *[http://www.teachersband.com Teachers official website] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bronfman, Benjamin}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:African-American Jews]] [[Category:African-American musicians]] [[Category:American environmentalists]] [[Category:American people of African descent]] [[Category:American people of Russian-Jewish descent]] [[Category:Bronfman family|Benjamin]] [[Category:Collegiate School (New York) alumni]] [[Category:Emerson College alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Musicians from New York City]] [[Category:Canadian people of African-American descent]] [[Category:Lehman family]] [[Category:Loeb family]]

{{No footnotes|date=October 2013}} '''Business and Enterprise Colleges''' (BECs) were introduced in 2002 as part of the [[Specialist school|Specialist Schools Programme]] in England. The system enables [[secondary school]]s to specialise in certain fields. Schools that successfully apply to the [[Specialist Schools Trust]] and become Business and Enterprise Colleges receive extra funding for applied business teaching from this joint private sector and government scheme. Business and Enterprise Colleges also act as a local point of reference for other schools and businesses in the area, with an emphasis on promoting enterprise and commercial awareness within the community.
==Schools' Enterprise Education Network== In his budget speech of March 2006, the [[Chancellor of the Exchequer]], [[Gordon Brown]] announced that the government would be funding a network of best practice to support the delivery of Enterprise Education within the UK. This network (called the Schools' [[Business|Enterprise]] Education Network (SEEN) was based on the expertise within BECs—56 hubs (one per county) were identified in May 2006. At a launch conference the hub co-ordinators were advised of the local BECs that would act as 'spokes' to support the dissemination to all state-maintained secondary schools.

A '''business suite''' is a set of business software functions enabling the core business and business support processes inside and beyond the boundaries of an organization.
== Overview == The key characteristic of a business suite is the delivery of end-to-end [[business processes]] which span organizational boundaries such as business departments and locations. In the last years the focus of the business processes supported by business suites has expanded to integrate business partners such as customers, suppliers and service providers .
Business Suites are generally rooted in the traditional [[Enterprise resource planning|ERP]] systems that are based on a common [[data model]] used to storing the data to be shared between departments and their [[business processes]]. Most corporate ERP systems have been enhanced and complemented by additional applications over the years. As a result, the total cost of ownership ([[Total cost of ownership|TCO]]) grows, process integrity across applications is at stake, and the flexibility to consistently change and optimize business processes suffers. The vendors of business suites claim to address these issues.
== Topics == The issues with business process visibility, flexibility, efficiency, and integrity in heterogeneous business application environments have recently created 2 basic types of business suites:
* The "cumulative" business suite consists of a set of previously separate applications that are connected at the [[middleware]] or [[database]] level. The absence of a unified data and process model complicates the implementation of end-to-end processes with ensured process integrity for customers. System integrators are addressing this issue at the expense of a business suite owner. * The "organic" business suite delivers end-to-end business processes designed to run in one offering. Modern organic business suites provide additional openness to integrate with other applications or extend processes to business partners through [[Service-oriented architecture|SOA]] technologies.
== Business Process Scope == A business suite usually encompasses all core business and business support processes of an organization, unlike business applications such as [[treasury management]] or [[Customer relationship management|CRM]] that have been designed to serve a single [[line of business]].
Since no vendor today offers applications covering all business process requirements of larger organizations, vendors complement their application portfolio through acquisitions or through cooperation with specialized partners.
===Two strategies=== A "coverage through acquisition" strategy is confined to the processes that are entirely under the control of a single organization, while the "coverage through cooperation" approach can also enable and support processes that span the boundaries of multiple organizations like suppliers, customers, banks.
===Foundational processes=== The foundational set of [[business process]]es supported by a business suite includes business support processes to manage financials, build, develop and administer the workforce, run facilities, support the procurement of generic goods and services. Those foundational processes are required to sustain a functional enterprise that complies with all regulatory requirements.
===Value drivers=== The next layer of business processes is sometimes grouped by the main value drivers or differentiators of a company: * Development, production, sales, and distribution of [[Product (business)|products]] * Acquisition, operations, and compliance of production [[assets]] * Management of the production, logistics, and distribution network * Marketing, sales, production, and service for [[customer]]s * Cost/performance optimized procurement, production, and operations
===Processes in support of value drivers=== Key processes supporting those value drivers invariably span organizational boundaries and are relevant for multiple [[Line of business|lines of business]]. A typical [[business process]] that connects organizational entities is "order to cash" which can span sales, production, finance, logistics, billing and dispute management and influences important key performance indicators of the involved areas like "[[Free cash flow|free cash-flow]]", "[[customer satisfaction]]", "[[customer profitability]]", "fulfillment cost".
Some business suites offer a layer of deep industry processes - either through industry extensions of the core business suite or through a network of frequently certified 3rd party software providers which adopt compatible or identical process and data models.
===Current status=== Today, no commercial business suite can cover all business process requirements of a large organization. Modern business suites offer an environment in which an organization can develop or modify business processes reusing the supplied standard processes. Some advanced business suites allow the fast composition of new business processes from process fragments or process steps.
==See also== * [[SAP Business Suite]] * [[Oracle E-Business Suite]]

Boyden Gray On Clinton's Conduct as President and Starr's as Independent Counsel |date=August 2, 1998}} }} '''Clayland Boyden Gray''' (born February 6, 1943) is an attorney in private practice, formerly with [[Wilmer Cutler & Pickering]], then [[Wilmer Cutler Pickering Hale and Dorr]]. He is now a founding partner of the DC-based law firm, Boyden Gray & Associates LLP. He is also a former American diplomat and public servant. ==Early life and education== Gray is the son of President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]]'s national security adviser [[Gordon Gray (politician)|Gordon Gray]] and grandson of [[R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company]] president [[Bowman Gray Sr.]]. He attended [[Fay School]] and [[St. Mark's School (Massachusetts)|St. Mark's School]] in [[Southborough, Massachusetts]]. He graduated from [[Harvard University]] in 1964, and he wrote for ''[[The Harvard Crimson]]'' during his time in college.{{cite news |last=McCombs |first=Phil |date=March 31, 1989 |title=THE DISTANT DRUM OF C. BOYDEN GRAY |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/1989/03/31/the-distant-drum-of-c-boyden-gray/2076c120-ca1f-4753-bc50-7eb8d322cb3b/?noredirect=on&utm_term=.f3d5f11e0e8f |work=The Washington Post |access-date=October 3, 2018 }} He also served as a sergeant in the [[United States Marine Corps Reserve]] from 1965 to 1970. Gray later received a [[Juris Doctor|J.D.]] degree from the [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill|University of North Carolina]] law school, where he served as Editor-in-Chief of the UNC law review. He graduated in 1968. ==Career== After graduation, Gray clerked for Supreme Court Chief Justice [[Earl Warren]]. In 1968 he joined the firm of [[Wilmer Cutler & Pickering]], and become a partner in 1976. Gray took a leave of absence from the firm in 1981 to serve as legal counsel for Vice President [[George H. W. Bush]]. He also served as Counsel to the Presidential Task Force on Regulatory Relief, chaired by Vice President Bush. Gray later served as Director of the Office of Transition Counsel for the Bush transition team, and as Counsel to President Bush from 1989 to 1993. )During this time, Gray became one of the main architects of the 1990 [[Clean Air Act (United States)|Clean Air Act]] Amendments that suggested market solutions for environmental problems. He returned to Wilmer Cutler & Pickering in 1993 l, where his practice focused on a range of regulatory matters with an emphasis on environmental issues, including those relating to [[biotechnology]], [[trade]], clean air, and the management of risk. He also served as Chairman of the section of Administrative Law and Regulatory Practice of the [[American Bar Association]]. Gray also served as co-chairman with former Mjority Leader [[Dick Armey]] of [[FreedomWorks]]. In October 2001 rumors indicated that Gray was considering running for an open [[US Senate]] seat in his native [[North Carolina]], but he passed on the race.{{citation needed|date=October 2015}} Former [[US Secretary of Labor]] [[Elizabeth Dole]] was elected in November 2002 to replace [[Jesse Helms]], who chose to retire, rather than seek a sixth term. Gray served on the Bush-Cheney Transition Department of Justice Advisory Committee, and as [[White House Counsel]] to [[US President]] [[George H. W. Bush]]. In 2002, he founded the Committee for Justice, a [[Washington, DC]]-based nonprofit dedicated to screening judicial and [[US Justice Department]] nominees.{{cite web|url=https://www.committeeforjustice.org/about|title=The Committee for Justice - Official Site|website=The Committee for Justice - Official Site|access-date=2017-05-09}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2005/05/23/AR2005052301640.html|title=A Moving Force In Fight for Bush's Judicial Nominees|last=Birnbaum|first=Jeffrey H.|date=2005-05-24|work=The Washington Post|access-date=2017-05-09|language=en-US |issn=0190-8286}} He took up the post of [[United States Ambassador to the European Union]] on 17 January 2006, when President [[George W. Bush]] granted him a [[recess appointment]] to the post.[https://georgewbush-whitehouse.archives.gov/news/releases/2006/01/20060117-4.html ''Personnel Announcement''] – President George W. Bush, 2006-01-19; [http://www.wilmerhale.com/about/news/newsDetail.aspx?news=601 WilmerHale announcement] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060317122840/http://www.wilmerhale.com/about/news/newsDetail.aspx?news=601 |date=2006-03-17 }} He took a leave of absence from with the law firm [[Wilmer Cutler Pickering Hale and Dorr]] to accept that position. When Gray emerged as Bush's preferred candidate for the post of the US's [[ambassador]] to the EU in July 2005,[https://georgewbush-whitehouse.archives.gov/news/releases/2005/07/20050725-6.html "Personnel Announcement"], President George W. Bush, 2008-07-25. the potential nomination deeply perturbed [[Open-source license|open source]] [[advocate]]s, who viewed his ties to [[Microsoft]] with suspicion.[http://management.silicon.com/government/0,39024677,39151152,00.htm "Bush's man in Europe slammed as Microsoft ally"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050811005538/http://management.silicon.com/government/0,39024677,39151152,00.htm# |date=2005-08-11 }}, ''Silicon.com'', 2005-08-05. Gray's most recent government position was as Special Envoy for European Affairs and [[Special Envoy for Eurasian Energy]] at the Mission of the [[United States]] to the [[European Union]], having been nominated by [[United States Secretary of State]] [[Condoleezza Rice]] on January 11, 2008. On March 31, the [[White House]] announced his appointment to the additional post of Special Envoy for Eurasian Energy.[http://useu.usmission.gov/About_The_Ambassador/default.asp ''About the US Special Envoy for European Affairs''] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061230090642/http://useu.usmission.gov/About_The_Ambassador/default.asp |date=2006-12-30 }} President [[George H. W. Bush|H. W. Bush]] in 1993 awarded him the [[Presidential Citizens Medal]].[http://www.awardsandhonors.com/award/presidentialcitizensmedal.html Awards and Honors.com] He is a member of the board of directors at the [[Atlantic Council]], [[The European Institute]], [[FreedomWorks]] and America Abroad Media.{{cite web |url=http://americaabroadmedia.org/user/47/James_K._Glassman |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-06-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140716203739/http://americaabroadmedia.org/user/47/James_K._Glassman |archivedate=2014-07-16 |df= }} In addition, Gray is or was a member of the [[Federalist Society]], [[Harvard University]]'s Committee on University Development, the Board of Trustees of the Washington Scholarship Fund, St. Mark's School, and [[National Cathedral School]].{{cite web| title=About FreedomWorks: Board of Directors|publisher=[[FreedomWorks]]|accessdate=2012-12-26|url=http://www.freedomworks.org/about/board-of-directors}}{{cite web|title=C. U.S. | altitude = | coordinates = | start_date = | completion_date = | inauguration_date = | renovation_date = | demolition_date = | destruction_date = | height = | diameter = | antenna_spire = | roof = | top_floor = | other_dimensions = | floor_count = | floor_area = | seating_type = | seating_capacity = | elevator_count = | main_contractor = | architect = | architecture_firm = | structural_engineer = | services_engineer = | civil_engineer = | other_designers = | quantity_surveyor = | awards = | ren_architect = | ren_firm = | ren_str_engineer = | ren_serv_engineer = | ren_civ_engineer = | ren_oth_designers = | ren_qty_surveyor = | ren_awards = | references = }} The '''CBS Broadcast Center''' is a television and radio production facility located in [[New York City]]. It is [[CBS]]'s main [[East Coast of the United States|East Coast]] production center, much as [[CBS Television City]] in [[Los Angeles]] is the [[West Coast of the United States|West Coast]] hub. It is also where the satire show ''[[Last Week Tonight]]'' is recorded. ==Overview== The nearly block-long facility at 524 West 57th Street, in the [[Hell's Kitchen, Manhattan|Hell's Kitchen]] section of [[Manhattan]], serves as the headquarters of [[CBS News]], the [[CBSN]] live streaming news channel and the main broadcast facility for CBS News, [[CBS Sports]], New York City [[Owned-and-operated station|O&O]] flagship station [[WCBS-TV]], and CBS-owned independent station [[WLNY]]. [[Black Entertainment Television|BET]] also used the Broadcast Center for then ''[[106 & Park]]'' and other in-studio shows for the network (Both BET and CBS were part of [[Viacom (1971–2005)|Viacom]] before being separated by the Viacom/CBS split). [[CBS Television Distribution]]'s nationally syndicated newsmagazine, ''[[Inside Edition]]'', is also taped at the CBS Broadcast Center. The Broadcast Center is also the production base for the [[CBS Radio News]]. The network's Master Control (aka Central Control) on the first floor also serves as the routing center for other programming distributed by [[Westwood One (1976–2011)|Westwood One]] (formerly [[Dial Global]]). The radio network's flagship station, [[WCBS (AM)]], was housed in the Broadcast Center from 2000 (moving from [[CBS Building|Black Rock]], CBS's corporate headquarters at 51 West [[52nd Street (Manhattan)|52nd Street]]) until 2011 when it relocated to 345 Hudson Street in lower Manhattan, billed on-air as "The CBS Hudson Square Broadcast Center." In addition to the Broadcast Center, CBS has one other major studio in Manhattan — the [[Ed Sullivan Theater]] (CBS-TV Studio 50) at 1697 Broadway, the home of ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]]''. The [[General Motors Building (New York)|General Motors Building]] (CBS-TV Studio 58), on [[Fifth Avenue]] and 58th Street, was the home of ''[[The Early Show]]'' until December 31, 2011. ''The Early Show''{{'}}s successor, the second and current incarnation of ''[[CBS This Morning]]'', premiered from newly constructed Studio 57 at the Broadcast Center on January 9, 2012. The ''[[CBS Evening News]]'' moved into Studio 57 from Studio 47 (previously sharing space with the CBS News newsroom) in December 2016.{{cite web|title=A look back at ‘CBS Evening News’ in Studio 47 |url=https://www.newscaststudio.com/2016/12/07/cbs-evening-news-studio-47/ |work=Newscast Studio |date=December 7, 2016 |accessdate=September 13, 2018}} The Center opened as the CBS Production Center in the late 1950s, when the network's master control, film and videotape facilities, and four studios were located in the [[Grand Central Terminal]] building. Operations moved from Grand Central to the Broadcast Center in stages, ending in late 1964. From the 1950s to 1970s, another prominent CBS stage in New York was Studio 52 (now the disco-theater [[Studio 54]]) at 254 West [[54th Street (Manhattan)|54th Street]], around the corner from Studio 50. CBS also leased the Himan Brown studios at 221 West 26th Street, now [[Chelsea Studios]], for several shows in the 1960s, 1970s, and 1980s. In early 2012, it was announced ''[[The Nate Berkus Show]]'' would not be renewed. After a few months it was announced that [[Anderson Cooper]]'s talk show would move into Studio 42 leaving its home in the [[Time Warner Center]]. Also in 2012, CBS acquired the [[Riverhead, New York|Riverhead]], [[Long Island]]-licensed [[WLNY-TV]] (Channel 55, cable channel 10), setting up a duopoly with WCBS-TV. Following the merger, CBS moved that station's employees to the CBS Broadcast Center, with their former [[Melville, New York|Melville]] facility maintained as the WCBS/WLNY Long Island bureau offices. WLNY currently carries one program from Broadcast Center: a 9pm newscast with WCBS's news personnel from Broadcast Center. ''Live from the Couch'', a morning show airing parallel to ''CBS This Morning'' on WCBS, was broadcast on WLNY from 2012 until early 2014, when it was canceled due to low ratings. ==History== ===CBS takes over the depot=== The building in which the Broadcast Center is located formerly served as a dairy depot for Sheffield Farms. CBS, which had been using studios at [[Grand Central Terminal]] and other theaters throughout Manhattan, purchased the site in 1952 and began using it regularly for TV in 1963. The radio network, with offices at 1 East 53rd Street and studios at 49 East 52nd Street, near the old CBS corporate headquarters at 485 [[Madison Avenue]], moved to the Broadcast Center in July 1964, while the television network's master control moved from Grand Central to the Broadcast Center in late 1964. The company spent $14.5 million to create what was, at the time, "the largest 'self-contained' radio and television production center in the United States and the most modern broadcasting plant of its kind in the world," as the ''New York Tribune'' put it in 1961. ===CBS Broadcast Center and soap operas=== Until January 2000, the Broadcast Center was home to CBS-TV's soap opera ''[[As the World Turns]]''. Defunct serials ''[[Love of Life]]'', ''[[Search for Tomorrow]]'', ''[[Love is a Many Splendored Thing (TV series)|Love is a Many Splendored Thing]]'', and ''[[Where the Heart Is (1969 TV series)|Where the Heart Is]]'' were also produced at the Broadcast Center. After a 37-year absence, ''[[Guiding Light]]'' returned to the Broadcast Center in September 2005, after 17 years at [[EUE/Screen Gems]] studios, 222 East 44th Street and 20 years at the [[Chelsea Studios|CBS/Himan Brown studios at 221 West 26th Street]]. The show had been produced in Studio 45 at the CBS Broadcast Center from 1965 to 1968 before moving to West 26th Street. ''GL'' used Studios 42 and 45 until its final broadcast on September 18, 2009. ===''"From the ABC Broadcast Center..."''=== In 1996, [[Brillstein-Grey Entertainment]] produced ''[[The Dana Carvey Show]]'' at the Broadcast Center for [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]. As a jab at CBS ([[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s competition), the show's opening credits had a man with a paper version of the [[American Broadcasting Company logos|ABC logo]] on a ladder outside of the Broadcast Center covering over the [[CBS Eye logo]] while the announcer proclaimed "From the ABC Broadcast Center". ==Studios== *33: ''[[60 Minutes]]'' *41: Currently vacant *42: ''[[Last Week Tonight with John Oliver]]'' / ''[[Full Frontal with Samantha Bee]]'' *43: [[CBS Sports]]/[[CBS Sports Network]] *44: [[CBS Sports Network]], formerly housed ''[[Good Morning The '''Center for Labor and Community Research (CLCR)''' is a [[501(c)#501(c)(3)|501c3]] [[Non-profit organization|not-for-profit organization]] based in [[Chicago|Chicago, Illinois]].
== History == Originally named the Midwest Center for Labor Research, CLCR was founded in 1982 in order to examine the causes and effects of the sharp decline in manufacturing in the 1970s. The goal of CLCR's early research was to determine whether this rapid [[deindustrialization]] in the United States was an inevitable consequence of globalization and [[Technology|technological development]] or whether it was a trend that could be slowed or reversed by effective policy changes.
After almost two decades of in-depth research, CLCR concluded that 80% of losses in manufacturing could have been averted, avoiding much of the subsequent rise in poverty across manufacturing-dependent communities.
== References == * Swinney, D (1998). ''Building the Bridge to the High Road''. [http://hdl.handle.net/1813/45890] * [[Chicago Federation of Labor]] and Center for Labor and Community Research (2001). ''Creating a Manufacturing Career Path System in Cook County''. [http://clcr.org/publications/pdf/final%20MWDP%20report030802.pdf]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * Center for Labor & Community Research (2003). ''The State of Illinois Manufacturing''. [http://clcr.org/publications/pdf/ima_report.pdf]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}
==External links== * [http://www.clcr.org Center for Labor & Community Research (CLCR)] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090225103125/http://chicagomanufacturing.org/ Chicago Manufacturing Renaissance Council (CMRC)] * [http://www.austinpolytech.com Austin Polytechnical Academy (APA)]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Center For Labor And Community Research}} [[Category:Business organizations based in the United States]]

A '''Certificate of Formula Compliance''' (often abbreviated to COFC) is a document used primarily for Health and Beauty Products in international trade.
Unlike a [[Certificate of Origin]] (which traditionally states from what country the shipped goods originate, but "originate" in a CO does not mean the country the goods are shipped from, but the country where their goods are actually made.)a COFC is a document that states to the Import Authority that the Products are certified accurate to the Formula that is on record in the Country of Importation.
Unlike a [[Certificate of Analysis]](a Document used to detail the exact formula of the product being tested) a COFC states that the product in question conforms exactly to the formula of record.
A COFC is a new compliance document that has not been universally adopted as a standard for International Trade. There is a push to include its use and using it even in a Country that has not formally adopted its use has helped speed the inspection process.
One of other International Documents used in International trade:
==See also==
*[[Certificate of Origin]] *[[Certificate of Free Sale]] *[[Certificate of Analysis]]

{{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Original research|date=October 2013}} {{Conflict of laws}}
A '''choice of law clause'''<ref>{{cite web|last1=Larson|first1=Aaron|title=Common Contract Clauses|url=https://www.expertlaw.com/library/business/contract_clauses.html#choice-of-law-and-forum-clause|website=ExpertLaw.com|accessdate=11 October 2017|date=22 July 2016}}</ref> or '''proper law clause'''<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Sinclair|first1=Anthony C.|title=The Origins of the Umbrella Clause in the International Law of Investment Protection|journal=Arbitration International|date=December 2004|volume=20|issue=4|pages=411–434|url=https://academic.oup.com/arbitration/article-abstract/20/4/411/271721|accessdate=11 October 2017|doi=10.1093/arbitration/20.4.411}}</ref> is a term of a [[contract]] in which the [[party (law)|parties]] specify that any dispute arising under the contract shall be determined in accordance with the law of a particular [[jurisdiction (area)|jurisdiction]].<ref>{{citation |title=choice of law clause |work=Webster's New World Law Dictionary |publisher=Wiley Publishing, Inc. |place=Hoboken, New Jersey |year=2006}}</ref>
==Explanation== As business transactions and contractual obligations may cross jurisdictional borders within a nation, as well as international borders, both physically and electronically, [[choice of law]] issues may arise in the event that it is necessary to interpret the terms of a contract or in the event of litigation over a contract dispute. As laws vary between jurisdictions, it is possible that contract terms could be interpreted differently between jurisdictions, or that portions of a contract that are enforceable in one jurisdiction would not be enforceable under the laws of another. The parties may therefore agree in advance to interpret the contract in accord with the laws of a jurisdiction that is identified within their contract.<ref name="col">{{cite journal|last1=Woodward|first1=William J. Jr.|title=Legal Uncertainty and Aberrant Contracts: The Choice of Law Clause|journal=Chicago-Kent Law Journal|date=2004|volume=89|page=197|url=http://digitalcommons.law.scu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1818&context=facpubs|accessdate=11 October 2017}}</ref>
In some situations a court may find that there are public policy reasons to disregard a choice of law clause, and instead interpret a contract under the laws of the jurisdiction in which a lawsuit is filed. For example, a jurisdiction may find as a matter of public policy, it will apply its own consumer protection laws to a dispute between a consumer and a business even if the contract calls for the application of the laws of a different jurisdiction.<ref name="col"/><ref>{{cite journal|last1=Homle|first1=Julia|title=Global social media vs local values: Private international law should protect local consumer rights by using the public policy exception?|journal=Computer Law & Security Review|date=2017|volume=33|issue=6|url=http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0267364917302844|accessdate=11 October 2017|doi=10.1016/j.clsr.2017.08.008}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==Further reading== *[[Lea Brilmayer]] and Jack Goldsmith, ''Conflicts of Law: Cases and Materials, Fifth Edition'' (2002), p. 280-303.
==See also== *[[Forum selection clause]] *[[Arbitration clause]] *''[[Lex loci arbitri]]''
{{DEFAULTSORT:Choice Of Law Clause}} [[Category:Contract law]] [[Category:Conflict of laws]] [[Category:Contract clauses]]

'''Christian Leuz''' (born 1967) is a German business [[economist]], specializing in finance, accounting, and institutional economics. He is the Joseph Sondheimer Professor of International Economics, Finance and Accounting at the [[University of Chicago Booth School of Business]].
Leuz began his studies at JW Goethe Universität in Frankfurt, Germany where he studied business economics. At the University of Wisconsin, Madison, he received an M.S. in Finance and Management before returning to Germany to pursue his Ph.D. studies. In 1996 he received his Ph.D. in business economics, summa cum laude, and in 2000 he received his Habilitation (German post-doctorate degree) from JW Goethe Universität, Frankfurt.
Leuz's research examines the role of corporate disclosures, accounting transparency and disclosure regulation in capital markets, corporate governance and corporate financing. He currently serves as an editor of the ''[[Journal of Accounting Research]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Journal of Accounting Research|url=http://research.chicagobooth.edu/arc/journal-of-accounting-research/editorial-information|accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref> and as a Co-Director of Chicago Booth's [[Initiative on Global Markets]].<ref>{{cite web|title=The Initiative on Global Markets|url=http://research.chicagobooth.edu/IGM/faculty/index.aspx|accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref> He is a Research Associate at the [[National Bureau of Economic Research]]<ref>{{cite web|title=National Bureau of Economic Research|url=http://www.nber.org/people/christian_leuz|accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref> and a Fellow at the European Corporate Governance Institute,<ref>{{cite web|title=European Corporate Governance Institute|url=http://www.ecgi.org/members_directory/member.php?member_id=46|accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref> Wharton's Financial Institution Center,<ref>{{cite web|title=Wharton Financial Institution Center|url=http://fic.wharton.upenn.edu/fic/community.html|accessdate=15 August 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002174829/http://fic.wharton.upenn.edu/fic/community.html|archivedate=2 October 2016|df=}}</ref> Goethe University's Center for Financial Studies,<ref>{{cite web|title=Center for Financial Studies|url=https://www.ifk-cfs.de/about--fellows.html|accessdate=15 August 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140413231218/https://www.ifk-cfs.de/about--fellows.html|archivedate=13 April 2014|df=}}</ref> and in the CESifo Research Network.<ref>{{cite web|title=CESifo Research Network|url=http://www.cesifo-group.de/ifoHome/research/Network/Members.html}}</ref> He also serves as an economic advisor to the [[PCAOB]].<ref>{{cite news|title=PCAOB Announces Christian Leuz Joins the Center for Economic Analysis|url=http://pcaobus.org/News/Releases/Pages/01272014_Leuz.aspx|accessdate=15 August 2014|agency=PCAOB|date=January 27, 2014}}</ref>
==Awards== Leuz was recently recognized as a “Highly Cited Researchers"<ref>{{cite web|title=Highly Cited Researchers|url=http://highlycited.com/|accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref> by Thomson Reuters and included in their list of “The World’s Most Influential Scientific Minds 2014.”<ref>{{cite news|title=The World's Most Influential Scientific Minds 2014|url=http://sciencewatch.com/|accessdate=15 August 2014|agency=Thomson Reuters}}</ref> He is listed in the category 'Economics and Business'". Leuz was also recently awarded the "Distinguished Contributions to Accounting Literature Award," 2014 by the [[American Accounting Association]] for his paper "[http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0304405X03001211 Earnings management and investor protection: an international comparison]."<ref>{{cite web|title=Awards and Recognitions|url=http://research.chicagobooth.edu/arc/research-and-awards/awards-and-recognitions|publisher=Accounting Research Center|accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref>
Other notable awards that Leuz has received include the 2010 Notable Contributions to Accounting Literature Award (with Luzi Hail) from the American Accounting Association<ref>{{cite news|title=Hail and Leuz receive AAA 2010 Notable Contributions to Accounting Literature Award|url=http://aaahq.org/awards/PressRelease/2010.htm#NotableContributions|accessdate=15 August 2014|agency=American Accounting Association}}</ref> and, in 2012, the prestigious [[Humboldt Research Award]] in recognition of the impact his work has had on the field of business economics.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Friedman|first1=Allan|title=Christian Leuz awarded Humboldt Research Award|url=http://news.uchicago.edu/article/2012/05/29/christian-leuz-awarded-humboldt-research-award|accessdate=15 August 2014|date=May 29, 2012}}</ref>
==References== <references />
==External links== *[http://faculty.chicagobooth.edu/christian.leuz/ Christian Leuz’s home page] at the [[University of Chicago]]. *[https://www.nber.org/authors/christian_leuz Publications] at the National Bureau of Economic Research. *[https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/cf_dev/AbsByAuth.cfm?per_id=18004 Publications] at the [[Social Science Research Network]]. *[http://worldcat.org/identities/lccn-n97117723/ Works by or about Christian Leuz] in libraries ([[WorldCat]] catalog).
